CISA says critical VMware RCE flaw now actively exploited

Tech 5 min read

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has identified active exploitation of a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in VMware's software. This flaw poses significant security risks, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code on unpatched systems without user interaction. The urgency of the situation has prompted CISA to urge organizations to prioritize upgrading their VMware environments and apply patches immediately to mitigate potential threats. This exploitation highlights the importance of maintaining up-to-date systems to safeguard against evolving cybersecurity risks.

AI 5 min read

This multi-stage attack targets business environments by impersonating popular communication platforms to deceive users into divulging sensitive information. The campaign utilizes AiTM techniques to intercept and manipulate ongoing communication threads, thereby gaining unauthorized access to corporate email accounts and sensitive data.
